posts.post_content: Excellent card. I can't tell you how many years of my life I've wasted trying to decide whether to attack or whether to chump block or what. I'm glad WotC finally made the decision for me. Thanks!

posts.post_content: Actually, this card is really not all that bad. Sure, it's a defender, but it's a 2/1 for {1}, and colorless too. Artifact allows it to help with affinity. It's not [Clockwork Beetle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clockwork Beetle) or anything, but certainly not the worst card.

posts.post_content: This card was made because Mirrodin develpment realised every color had a 2/1 for 1 mana. But artifacts didn't. So they created one.

Posted By: A3Kitsune (2/15/2010 8:34:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The best wall to combo [Glyph of Destruction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glyph of Destruction) and [Fling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fling) with; your opponent is more likely to attack this wall than most any other wall, since he's most likely to have a creature capable of killing it.   
  
Splash white for more better walls, [Righteousness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Righteousness) and [Brion Stoutarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brion Stoutarm). The only problem is that after a couple times the combo gets real predictable...
posts.html:
The best wall to combo Glyph of Destruction and Fling with; your opponent is more likely to attack this wall than most any other wall, since he's most likely to have a creature capable of killing it.

Splash white for more better walls, Righteousness and Brion Stoutarm. The only problem is that after a couple times the combo gets real predictable...
